data.title: Google agrees to pay big money for big-data startup Looker
data.text: Alphabet Inc.’s Google announced plans for the fourth largest acquisition in the company’s history Thursday, agreeing to spend $2.6 billion in cash for data and analytics software startup Looker.

data.title: Alphabet Acquires Looker To Boost Cloud Computing, Google Stock Slips
data.text:
Alphabet's Google made its first big cloud computing acquisition under new boss Thomas Kurian by purchasing data analytics firm Looker for $2.6 billion in cash, the company said Thursday.
The post Alphabet Acquires Looker To Boost Cloud Computing, Google Stock Slips appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.
